title: 60s Reynolds Wrap packaging type
content:
I'm looking to accurately identify the typeface used on this attached 60s Reynolds Wrap packaging. Any idea? Looks like a super compressed cut of Clarendon.

Any idea to the closest digital version of this that we can use/purchase?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Reynolds_Wrap_60s_6546.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Reynolds\_Wrap\_60s.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/typophile.com/files/Reynolds_Wrap_60s.jpg) | 16.55 KB |
author: royrub

comments.content: Looks like it's based on Egyptian Bold Condensed, probably custom as was normal for product labels/logos at that time. (The lowercase **r** has definitely been modified.)

Some Clarendon Condensed for you: [Consort](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/consort-rr) and BT [Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/clarendon) Condensed, [Besley Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/besley-clarendon), [Clarendon Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon-condensed-bold), [Antique 3](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique3), [Monotype Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418184317/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monotype-clarendon) (squooshing it)
